SALESFORCE STARTER
Promote My Business

Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite bring powerful tools into one marketing experience, where you can leverage customer data and engage the people who follow your brand. A streamlined campaign experience brings contacts and content together, while flows enhance and automate your daily tasks.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Starter and Pro Suite Editions. Your edition determines the options you have.
Getting Started

Email marketing must meet privacy regulations, so some setup is required to get going with a marketing campaign. Take care of these quick tasks, and then it’s on to the fun stuff!

To access these settings, click  and then click Open Advanced Settings. To find the relevant pages, start typing in the Quick Find box.

JOB TYPE	LOCATION	DETAILS
Required	

Business Details in Quick Settings

Company Information in Advanced Setup

	Enter your physical business address. This address is connected to the Physical Address merge field, which must appear in every promotional email to meet CAN-SPAM requirements.
Required	Organization-Wide Addresses	Add at least one email address to use as the sender in the From field of your emails.
Required	Leads or Contacts	Import your leads or contacts with their marketing consent details.
Optional	My Domain	Specify the subdomain to use in the URLs for creative assets and files you save in the Content area. This subdomain is also used in the login URL for your Salesforce Starter or Pro Suite app.
Optional	Einstein for Marketing	Choose whether to use AI with Salesforce Starter or Pro Suite. When you activate Einstein Send Time Optimization, data from the Salesforce global model supplements your Salesforce data to boost email engagement.
TIP The Company Information page also includes a Usage-Based Entitlements table, which contains allocation details about how many emails you can send. Review this table periodically, especially when scheduling emails for a future date. When usage is high, any user with the System Administrator profile can purchase bundles of email sends from the Billing and Purchases page.
Campaigns Are Key

The Marketing app provides streamlined access to powerful platform tools from other parts of Salesforce. You get power with less complexity, and the campaign record helps guide you as you build a marketing plan.

Let’s look at the parts of a campaign.

Audience: To target email recipients, create a segment. To build a segment, select criteria from object fields, such as an account ZIP code or last activity date. A segment’s population is dynamic and always gets updated immediately before an email is sent. 
Content: Build emails in the Salesforce CMS content builder. Drag components into the layout, and then edit text and insert images. To maintain a consistent style for your emails, select a brand. Use preview and test options to make sure your content looks great before you launch. 
Schedule: You can choose to launch campaign content immediately or schedule it for later. Use Einstein Send Time Optimization to automatically send each message when its recipient is most likely to open it.
Choosing a Starting Point

Instead of building a campaign from scratch, you have options for campaigns that make it easy to send one email or build a series of emails.

A campaign starts with a flow, which visualizes and automates multistep processes and connects data and publishing pipelines behind the scenes. Campaign flows come configured with one or more elements to get you started. You can add and edit flows from the campaign record. You can also add, move, and remove elements from each campaign flow in Flow Builder to meet your needs. See How Campaigns and Flows Work Together.

About Object Relationships

All your marketing work is connected to a campaign and one or more flows. Flows drive email sending and automation and bring together your audience, content, and scheduling details. These things are accessible from a campaign record.

Some objects have one-to-one relationships, while others can support one-to-many.

A campaign is related to one or more flows, one segment, and one or more emails.
A flow is related to one campaign.
You can use the same email in multiple campaigns.
You can use the same segment in multiple campaigns.
Tracking Success

Monitor the success of your emails so you can set marketing goals and refine campaigns. Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite come with engagement reports, dashboards, and folders to get you started. To share reports and dashboards, a user with the System Administrator profile can grant users access to engagement folders from the Browse tab in Analytics.

EXAMPLE At Ursa Major Solar, Erin and Lance are working on plans for the Alternative Energies Expo. To engage attendees beyond their booth, they decide to host a mixer for recent leads and contacts. They develop an email invitation and boost engagement with Einstein Send Time Optimization. Check out Trailhead to see how they do it.
EXAMPLE After the Alternative Energies Expo, the team is back in the office and hoping to follow up with the new people they met. Working with customer pros Lincoln and Ada, they develop a timely email series to educate and nurture the people who expressed an interest in solar technology. Check out Trailhead to see how they do it.
Marketing Considerations for Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite
The marketing tools and objects that you use in Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite have some nuances to understand.
Consent Management in Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite
Before you send promotional emails, make sure that you’re in compliance with regulations such as CAN-SPAM. Also, consider data syncing and timing when updating records and sending messages.
Marketing Segments
When you target a group within your audience, we call that a segment. In Salesforce Starter and Pro Suite, you build a segment by applying filter criteria, such as the person’s location or account name. Filter criteria are based on data objects that store information about your leads, contacts, and unified individuals.
Segment Examples
To get started quickly with segments, try a combination of commonly used fields. For best results, verify field values on corresponding records, and copy and paste those values into the segment canvas.
